<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/meta-shares-crushed-after-disappointing-earnings-report?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Meta has Facebook problems
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/meta-shares-crushed-after-disappointing-earnings-report?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Facebook logo transforming into a Meta logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ee5545cd7df2f2bf00fba880c8d3ee7557c0d407-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not everyone can pivot as gracefully as Selena Gomez.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As it transitions toward a focus on digital worlds, Meta is having heaps of trouble in the real one: Shares of the company previously known as Facebook crashed <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/02/facebook-parent-meta-fb-q4-2021-earnings.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 22%</a> (equivalent to nearly $200 billion wiped off of its market value) after it warned that revenue for the current quarter would come in below forecasts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the forefront of Meta’s challenges is the fact that its social platforms are losing relevance to companies like TikTok.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook's monthly users held steady last quarter at 2.91 billion.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And daily active users </span><span><em>declined </em></span><span>from 1.93 billion to 1.92 billion. It's Facebook's first quarter-to-quarter drop in global daily users in its history.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meta also said that ad sales, which account for the majority of its revenue, have been hurt by Apple's privacy updates and ongoing supply chain issues that’ve hit marketing budgets.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Metaverse to the rescue?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As part of its big name change last October, Meta said it would separate its Family of Apps unit (home to FB, Instagram, and Messenger) from other products tied to its push into the metaverse, like its virtual reality headsets. That unit, called Reality Labs, disclosed its financials for the first time: It made $877 million in revenue but lost $3.3 billion last quarter. Reality Labs lost more than $10 billion in total in 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It shows that the transformation of Meta into a metaverse company will be a slog (not to mention uber expensive), but one that CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes is necessary for it to become a leader in the “next chapter of the internet.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>24% of the more than 3,000 jobs listed on Meta’s website are for AR/VR roles, </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/31/technology/facebook-meta-change.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the NYT</a></span><span>. And the company’s already said it’s planning to create 10,000 jobs in the EU related to the metaverse.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meanwhile, some teams at Facebook and Instagram have shrunk, and employees on those products expect smaller budgets in the second half of the year, according to the Times.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>You can’t help but juxtapose Meta’s woes with the giddiness surrounding its fellow internet giant, Alphabet, whose stock soared 7.5% after a blowout earnings report Tuesday.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/jeff-zucker-cnn-president-resigns?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
CNN president exits stage left
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/jeff-zucker-cnn-president-resigns?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Jeff Zucker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/c100b5e970ae26d850016d502a5f7c3b6bc9813d-6000x3992.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Mike Coppola/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday was not a great day for people whose last names begin with Zuck...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CNN’s president for the last nine years, Jeff Zucker, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/media-telecom/jeff-zucker-resigns-cnn-president-2022-02-02/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">abruptly resigned</a>. He’s also stepping down from his role as chairman of CNN parent WarnerMedia’s news and sports division.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The media big shot—who previously served as president of NBC, where he was executive producer of the <em>Today</em> show and greenlit <em>The Apprentice</em>—said he failed to disclose a romantic relationship with his colleague, who has been identified as CNN’s EVP and CMO Allison Gollust. She’s planning to stay on.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Zucker explained in a memo that his relationship was discovered during CNN’s probe into former anchor Chris Cuomo’s conduct.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Refresher: </strong></span><span>Cuomo was fired in December for helping his brother, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, mitigate the fallout from sexual harrassment claims against him.</span>
</li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What will CNN do without its leader?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get three more. Top execs Michael Bass, Amy Entelis, and Ken Jautz have <a href="https://deadline.com/2022/02/jeff-zucker-cnn-interim-team-to-lead-1234925033/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been tapped</a> to co-pilot the network as it heads toward a merger between WarnerMedia and Discovery and the rollout of its hyped streaming service, CNN+. WarnerMedia CEO Jason Kilar said this Cerberus org chart will last until the Discovery deal is completed.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/paypal-stock-falls-another-stumble-for-pandemic-high-flyers?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
PayPal yesterday
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/paypal-stock-falls-another-stumble-for-pandemic-high-flyers?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="The PayPal logo coated in a layer of honey" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7b4234f7c392612e8d7bbb074316e9e90ba0524e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before Meta laid an egg in the afternoon, the laughing stock (get it) of the financial world yesterday was PayPal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company’s shares had their <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/paypal-shares-tumble-premarket-after-disappointing-outlook-11643803513?mod=hp_lead_pos3" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst day ever</a>, cratering nearly 25% in yet another case of a pandemic prodigy hitting a speedbump in the new normal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What is that new normal for PayPal? Lowering profit guidance for the current year and abandoning a target of doubling its active user base to 750 million by 2025.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The Venmo owner was a high-flying stock during the first waves of the pandemic as more consumers used digital payments and shopped online. In fact, at one point it was worth more than every US bank outside of JPMorgan.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But now, due to a variety of factors hitting people’s wallets, including supply chain bottlenecks, inflation, and the withdrawing of stimulus measures, it’s being uttered in the same breath as Zoom and Peloton as a company whose incredible success during the pandemic was perhaps more characteristic of a one-hit wonder than of a future star.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But not everyone is writing off PayPal. </strong>Analysts say the company could grow (albeit more slowly) thanks to its foothold in emerging sectors, such as buy now, pay later.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOGETHER WITH THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
Your $1K could be set to slay
</font>
</a>
</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-1k&aid=9463&paid=9463&waid=9463&source=esamnbwdg0500046&psource=esamnbwdg0500046&wsource=esamnbwdg0500046" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/4959/1643314142-Finance-224.jpg">
</a>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You heard us. <em>Slay. </em>There’s no other way to put it when massive tech trends catapult correlating stocks into greatness—and <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-1k&aid=9463&paid=9463&waid=9463&source=esamnbwdg0500046&psource=esamnbwdg0500046&wsource=esamnbwdg0500046" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a> has a knack for finding both.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And this time, it’s 5G that has their attention.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Motley Fool believes 5G has reached a pivotal inflection point,</strong> potentially ready to explode with opportunity, <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-1k&aid=9463&paid=9463&waid=9463&source=esamnbwdg0500046&psource=esamnbwdg0500046&wsource=esamnbwdg0500046" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making it a key spot in which to invest $1K right now</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Motley Fool has used their expertise to find an under-the-radar company with a cleverly positioned business model and tech that could <em>slay</em> no matter who wins among the bigwig carriers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-1k&aid=9463&paid=9463&waid=9463&source=esamnbwdg0500046&psource=esamnbwdg0500046&wsource=esamnbwdg0500046" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Find The Motley Fool’s pick, two bonus recs, and their special report on 5G here</a>.</p>
</td>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/key-performance-indicators-february-3?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/key-performance-indicators-february-3?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Image of code " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/58821e8b906429847de3736dd3c70b5be8f351e3-976x549.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>DeepMind</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>A computer can now code at the same level as an average human programmer. An AI system developed by Google’s DeepMind ranked within the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2022/2/2/22914085/alphacode-ai-coding-program-automatic-deepmind-codeforce?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top 54%</a> of human coders in a coding contest, marking the first time an AI code generation system performed competitively in programming competitions, DeepMind said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Obviously, I didn’t approve this.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Indie artist Ted Leo, along with a number of other musicians including Jack Antonoff, were <a href="https://mashable.com/article/hitpiece-nft-music?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">furious</a> after finding out this week that the website HitPiece was selling their famous songs as NFTs without their permission (some NFTs had received bids of up to $21.5 million). HitPiece semi-apologized Tuesday night, saying that it would ensure artists get paid if their unauthorized NFT sells, but some are calling the site a scam.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong><em>Pam & Tommy</em>: The true story of the sex tape that launched the internet. (<a href="https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/pam-tommy-true-story-sex-tape-fj52f67d6?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Times</a>)</p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/us-braces-another-winter-storm?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Half of the country is checking their flight status
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/us-braces-another-winter-storm?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="winter storm Landon map across US marking where ice storm and winter storm warnings, winter weather advisory, and winter storm watches." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/50b15baa55892daf023cc7a0b0346c9cb122131f-3543x1996.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>National Weather Service</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Welcome to Morning Brew, where we recognize winter storms even when they’re not specifically threatening New York. 100+ million people across at least 25 states stretching from New Mexico to Vermont (and even into Canada) are under <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/02/weather/winter-snowstorm-midwest-south-northeast-wednesday/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">winter storm alerts</a> through Friday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A massive storm adorably named Landon started its journey yesterday across parts of the South and Midwest, and it’s expected to say “howdy” to New England. Some areas are predicting heavy sleet and snow accumulations of up to one foot.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>6,000+ flights have been canceled through Thursday. Southwest Airlines already called a snow day for St. Louis on Wednesday and for Dallas on Thursday.</span></li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Clear eyes, full grid, maybe can lose power</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wide eyes are on Texas after last year’s winter storm that caused widespread electrical outages and killed an estimated 700 people. The freezing temps (as low as 17 degrees Farenheit in Dallas) and ice from Landon could challenge the state’s beleaguered power grid. Texas Governor Greg Abbott <a href="https://www.texastribune.org/2022/02/01/texas-winter-storm-power-outages/?utm_campaign=trib-social&utm_content=1643753986&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> Tuesday that “no one can guarantee” there won’t be power outages during the storm, contradicting assurances he made in December based on updates the state made to its grid. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Even crypto is winterizing…</strong>the biggest bitcoin miner in Texas, Riot Blockchain, shut down to conserve electricity ahead of the storm.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Last Seen </em>from WBUR is back, </strong>and it’s sharing 10 new mysteries about people, places, and things that have gone...missing. <a href="https://smarturl.it/lastseenpodcast?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Listen now</a> to season 2 wherever you get your podcasts.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
The puzzle section
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>One clue in today’s puzzle reads “Annual Austin, TX, media festival, for short.” Think you know it? <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/02/brew-mini-media?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three headlines and a lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than any groundhog not named Phil. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>School </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/27/1076208557/school-offers-full-tuition-to-58-students-after-a-scholarship-award-message-erro?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20220128&utm_term=6255103&utm_campaign=news&utm_id=58229737&orgid=309&utm_att1=" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offers</a></span><span> full tuition to 58 students after a scholarship award message error</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NASA </span><span><a href="https://futurism.com/nasa-plans-destroy-international-space-station?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announces</a></span><span> plans to destroy the International Space Station</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>40-person </span><span><a href="https://www.today.com/food/news/golden-corral-fight-rcna14500?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><span>brawl</span></a></span><span> breaks out at Golden Corral over steak</span>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs it transitions toward a focus on digital worlds, Meta is having heaps of trouble in the real one: Shares of the company previously known as Facebook crashed \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/02/facebook-parent-meta-fb-q4-2021-earnings.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly 22%\u003c/a\u003e (equivalent to nearly $200 billion wiped off of its market value) after it warned that revenue for the current quarter would come in below forecasts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the forefront of Meta’s challenges is the fact that its social platforms are losing relevance to companies like TikTok.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacebook's monthly users held steady last quarter at 2.91 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd daily active users \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003edeclined \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003efrom 1.93 billion to 1.92 billion. It's Facebook's first quarter-to-quarter drop in global daily users in its history.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeta also said that ad sales, which account for the majority of its revenue, have been hurt by Apple's privacy updates and ongoing supply chain issues that’ve hit marketing budgets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMetaverse to the rescue?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs part of its big name change last October, Meta said it would separate its Family of Apps unit (home to FB, Instagram, and Messenger) from other products tied to its push into the metaverse, like its virtual reality headsets. That unit, called Reality Labs, disclosed its financials for the first time: It made $877 million in revenue but lost $3.3 billion last quarter. Reality Labs lost more than $10 billion in total in 2021.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt shows that the transformation of Meta into a metaverse company will be a slog (not to mention uber expensive), but one that CEO Mark Zuckerberg believes is necessary for it to become a leader in the “next chapter of the internet.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e24% of the more than 3,000 jobs listed on Meta’s website are for AR/VR roles, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/31/technology/facebook-meta-change.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the NYT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. And the company’s already said it’s planning to create 10,000 jobs in the EU related to the metaverse.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMeanwhile, some teams at Facebook and Instagram have shrunk, and employees on those products expect smaller budgets in the second half of the year, according to the Times.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eYou can’t help but juxtapose Meta’s woes with the giddiness surrounding its fellow internet giant, Alphabet, whose stock soared 7.5% after a blowout earnings report Tuesday.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMike Coppola/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday was not a great day for people whose last names begin with Zuck...\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCNN’s president for the last nine years, Jeff Zucker, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/media-telecom/jeff-zucker-resigns-cnn-president-2022-02-02/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabruptly resigned\u003c/a\u003e. He’s also stepping down from his role as chairman of CNN parent WarnerMedia’s news and sports division.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe media big shot—who previously served as president of NBC, where he was executive producer of the \u003cem\u003eToday\u003c/em\u003e show and greenlit \u003cem\u003eThe Apprentice\u003c/em\u003e—said he failed to disclose a romantic relationship with his colleague, who has been identified as CNN’s EVP and CMO Allison Gollust. She’s planning to stay on.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eZucker explained in a memo that his relationship was discovered during CNN’s probe into former anchor Chris Cuomo’s conduct.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRefresher: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCuomo was fired in December for helping his brother, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, mitigate the fallout from sexual harrassment claims against him.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat will CNN do without its leader?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGet three more. Top execs Michael Bass, Amy Entelis, and Ken Jautz have \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2022/02/jeff-zucker-cnn-interim-team-to-lead-1234925033/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen tapped\u003c/a\u003e to co-pilot the network as it heads toward a merger between WarnerMedia and Discovery and the rollout of its hyped streaming service, CNN+. WarnerMedia CEO Jason Kilar said this Cerberus org chart will last until the Discovery deal is completed.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"The PayPal logo coated in a layer of honey\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7b4234f7c392612e8d7bbb074316e9e90ba0524e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore Meta laid an egg in the afternoon, the laughing stock (get it) of the financial world yesterday was PayPal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company’s shares had their \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/paypal-shares-tumble-premarket-after-disappointing-outlook-11643803513?mod=hp_lead_pos3\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworst day ever\u003c/a\u003e, cratering nearly 25% in yet another case of a pandemic prodigy hitting a speedbump in the new normal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat is that new normal for PayPal? Lowering profit guidance for the current year and abandoning a target of doubling its active user base to 750 million by 2025.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Venmo owner was a high-flying stock during the first waves of the pandemic as more consumers used digital payments and shopped online. In fact, at one point it was worth more than every US bank outside of JPMorgan.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut now, due to a variety of factors hitting people’s wallets, including supply chain bottlenecks, inflation, and the withdrawing of stimulus measures, it’s being uttered in the same breath as Zoom and Peloton as a company whose incredible success during the pandemic was perhaps more characteristic of a one-hit wonder than of a future star.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp Some areas are predicting heavy sleet and snow accumulations of up to one foot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e6,000+ flights have been canceled through Thursday. Southwest Airlines already called a snow day for St. Louis on Wednesday and for Dallas on Thursday.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eClear eyes, full grid, maybe can lose power\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWide eyes are on Texas after last year’s winter storm that caused widespread electrical outages and killed an estimated 700 people. The freezing temps (as low as 17 degrees Farenheit in Dallas) and ice from Landon could challenge the state’s beleaguered power grid. Texas Governor Greg Abbott \u003ca href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2022/02/01/texas-winter-storm-power-outages/?utm_campaign=trib-social\u0026utm_content=1643753986\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_source=twitter\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e Tuesday that “no one can guarantee” there won’t be power outages during the storm,
